security: This document contains lists of cryptonyms, pseudonyms, aliases, and true names related to CIA personnel and operations, particularly those concerning Cuba. Releasing this information could compromise ongoing operations, expose the identities of individuals involved in sensitive activities, and reveal connections between pseudonyms and real individuals, potentially endangering them. Specific examples include mappings of crypts and pseudos to actual individuals, like 'AMEER is Aureliano SANCHEZ Arango' and 'AMPATROL...true name Santos TRAFFICANTE.' Additionally, identifying relationships with the 'Frente Revolucionario Democratico' and other organizations could expose sensitive liaisons.
summary: This document is a compilation of lists containing cryptonyms, aliases, true names, and project code names related to CIA personnel, assets, and operations, with a significant focus on Cuban-related activities and responses to requests from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA).
summary_one_paragraph: This document comprises various lists of cryptonyms, pseudonyms, and real names associated with CIA activities, particularly those involving Cuban operations. It includes lists of code names, aliases, and true identities of individuals and projects, responses to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) regarding crypts and associated personnel, routing indicators, and memorandum of calls related to the information. The material spans personnel, routing indicators, Cuban operations, and connections to figures like Santos Trafficante and organizations like the Frente Revolucionario Democratico.
title: Request for Cuba Desk Crypts by House Select Committee on Assassinations
persons_mentioned: Eduardo Alfredo Espinosa de Los Monteros de Zulueta
Pedro Julio Martinez Fraga y Fernandez
Jose Ignacio Augusto Rasco y Bermudez
